title: Jack's Battle with Persistent Depression
clinical_history: Jack is a 42-year-old IT professional working from home. Over the past 6 months, Jack has experienced progressively worsening feelings of sadness, lack of motivation, and general disinterest in activities he once enjoyed. He notes difficulty in concentrating, frequent fatigue, and a sense of hopelessness. These symptoms have impacted both his personal and professional life, leading to decreased work performance and withdrawal from friends and family. Jack mentions having trouble sleeping, often waking up in the middle of the night and taking hours to fall back asleep, which leaves him feeling unrested in the morning.

nprs.affected_area: mental strain, associated with lack of motivation and sadness

aggrevating_factors: Prolonged work hours, social gatherings, and unsupportive comments from colleagues further intensify his feelings of inadequacy and hopelessness.
picture: Jack's 24-hour cycle includes trouble sleeping, a low mood upon waking, difficulty concentrating throughout work hours, and general fatigue leading to early bedtime.
easing_factors: Jack finds temporary relief through mindfulness meditation, short walks outside, and reading uplifting literature, though these are not consistently practiced.
past_history: Jack experienced mild depression during his college years, particularly around exam periods, but it resolved following graduation. He has never required medication for depression previously.
medical_history: History of anxiety managed with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) two years ago, which was successful. No significant physical health issues.
medications: Recently prescribed selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) to assist in managing depressive symptoms.
personal_history: Single, living alone in a city apartment. Jack has limited family interactions, mainly engaging via phone calls. He has a small circle of friends but has become increasingly isolated.
imaging: None required; diagnosis is primarily clinical based on psychiatric evaluation.
